      tags: [

      ],

  {

        'Psychedelic Research',
        'Drug Market',
        'Misinformation',
        'Disinformation',
        'Conspiracy Theory',
        'Conspiracies',

        'Ethical Hacking',
        'Quantum Theory',
        'Multiverse'
      ],
      and_or: 'and'
    }
  }
];

// ---- helpers ----
const slugify = (s) => s.toString()
  .trim().toLowerCase()
  .normalize('NFKD').replace(/[\u0300-\u036f]/g, '')
  .replace(/[^a-z0-9]+/g, '-')
  .replace(/(^-|-$)+/g, '');

// ---- extract WP payload from input OR fallback to other nodes ----
let wpTagsMap, wpCategoriesMap, wpAuthorsMap;

// 1) Try from current input
const payload = items?.[0]?.json;
if (payload && Array.isArray(payload.data)) {
  for (const entry of payload.data) {
    if (entry.tags)       wpTagsMap       = entry.tags;
    if (entry.categories) wpCategoriesMap = entry.categories;
    if (entry.authors)    wpAuthorsMap    = entry.authors;
  }
}

// 2) Fallback: try named nodes if you have them
if (!wpTagsMap)        wpTagsMap        = $items('Parse Tags')?.[0]?.json?.tags;
if (!wpCategoriesMap)  wpCategoriesMap  = $items('Parse Categories')?.[0]?.json?.categories;
if (!wpAuthorsMap)     wpAuthorsMap     = $items('Parse Authors')?.[0]?.json?.authors;

// Guard against undefined
wpTagsMap        = wpTagsMap       || {};
wpCategoriesMap  = wpCategoriesMap || {};
wpAuthorsMap     = wpAuthorsMap    || {};

// Convenience slug→id maps
const tagSlugToId = Object.fromEntries(Object.entries(wpTagsMap).map(([slug, obj]) => [slug, obj.id]));
const catSlugToId = Object.fromEntries(Object.entries(wpCategoriesMap).map(([slug, obj]) => [slug, obj.id]));
const authorSlugToId = Object.fromEntries(Object.entries(wpAuthorsMap).map(([slug, obj]) => [slug, obj.id]));

// ---- annotate categories with WP id/slug if present ----
const mergedCategories = categories.map(c => {
  const slug = c.slug ? c.slug : slugify(c.name);
  const wpCat = wpCategoriesMap[slug]; // { id, name } if exists
  return {
    ...c,
    slug,
    wp: {
      id: wpCat ? wpCat.id : null,
      slug: wpCat ? slug : null,
      matched: !!wpCat
    }
  };
});

// ---- final return ----
return [{
  json: {
    categories: mergedCategories,
    wp: {
      url: $('Set Target Wordpress URL').first().json.wordpress_url,
      categories: wpCategoriesMap,  // slug → {id,name}
      tags: wpTagsMap,              // slug → {id,name}
      authors: wpAuthorsMap,        // slug → {id,name}
      maps: {
        categorySlugToId: catSlugToId,
        tagSlugToId: tagSlugToId,
        authorSlugToId: authorSlugToId
      }
    }
  }
}];

parameters.content:
## Get Wordpress Tags, Categories, and Authors
- Get Data from wordpress. These will be passed to the GPT to insure it generates tags only based off what is in Wordpress
- RETURN config complete with helper functions to access Tags, Categories, and Authors via slugs as keys and return wordpress IDs

## Set Wordpress Target to POST to
- edit this node to point to a different blog
- NOTE: you will need to update the credential to match the new blog as well
